question: What types of programs do you use Scala most often for?
Which types of resources did you use to learn Scala?

answers.answer: personal interactions with other Scala people
Books, but It was 15 years ago
Reading code, YouTube videos, Live online programming sessions
Work with no previous jvm experience
Internet forums, Slacks, reading source code
Online chats like Discord, Gitter previously
Scala is pretty standard, no courses necessary.
Websites and blogs with tutotrials or explanations
Reading the source code of the compiler
Learning with peers and community and Pet projects

I explore technologies using TDD as I view it like a petri dish for experimentation. Working with skilled people as well. I don't do well in course structures as I lose attention easily when it is verbal/audio/video. Needs to be written for me to read and be able to be given time to work out pointed questions. I like theory a lot.
Haskell resources where Scala FP resources are fewer (e.g. recursion schemes)
YouTube and other online learning materials
